MPM.content: each deconstructive thinking constitutes a text which bears its rhetorical singularity (style of promise, figure of signature)
MPM.linkedContent: each deconstructive thinking constitutes a text which bears its rhetorical singularity (style of promise, figure of signature)

EM.content: Nietzsche: if there is style it must be plural [perhaps we need a change of “style”]
EM.linkedContent: Nietzsche: if there is style it must be plural [perhaps we need a change of “style”]

T.content: logic of event, structures of expropriation: timbre (tympanum), style and signature > same obliterating division of the proper, make every event possible, necessary, unfindable
T.linkedContent: logic of event, structures of expropriation: timbre (tympanum), style and signature > same obliterating division of the proper, make every event possible, necessary, unfindable

DS.content: graft/graph (both from graphion, writing implement, stylus) — bridge graft; capital title as scion/graft (can’t tell whether its present or absent anymore)
DS.linkedContent: graft/graph (both from graphion, writing implement, stylus) — bridge graft; capital title as scion/graft (can’t tell whether its present or absent anymore)

P.content: to go against feast [re: hermeneutic circle of philosophy & art] do not mix genres but extend metaphors (you can always try: question of style) > i.e. feast top to toe, circling step
P.linkedContent: to go against feast [re: hermeneutic circle of philosophy & art] do not mix genres but extend metaphors (you can always try: question of style) > i.e. feast top to toe, circling step

SP.content: “question of style” always concerned w/ weight (le pesant) of pointy object (stiletto, stylus, rapier, quill), which attacks matter/matrix, leaving a mark
SP.linkedContent: “question of style” always concerned w/ weight (le pesant) of pointy object (stiletto, stylus, rapier, quill), which attacks matter/matrix, leaving a mark

SP.content: also the protection against this threat, se pliant alors ou repliant, en fuite, derrière des voiles
SP.linkedContent: also the protection against this threat, se pliant alors ou repliant, en fuite, derrière des voiles

SP.content: question of style, des voiles, laissons l’élytre flotter entre masculin et féminin > our tongue [the French one] assures la jouissance [re: double gender of des voiles]
SP.linkedContent: question of style, des voiles, laissons l’élytre flotter entre masculin et féminin > our tongue [the French one] assures la jouissance [re: double gender of des voiles]

SP.content: style advances as spur: 1) prow of sailing vessel, rostrum, cleaving hostile surface of sea 2) rocky point, also éperon, on which waves break at harbor’s entrance
SP.linkedContent: style advances as spur: 1) prow of sailing vessel, rostrum, cleaving hostile surface of sea 2) rocky point, also éperon, on which waves break at harbor’s entrance

SP.content: protects against what stubbornly (avec entêtement) se donne à voir [thrusts itself into view]
SP.linkedContent: protects against what stubbornly (avec entêtement) se donne à voir [thrusts itself into view]

SP.content: style-spur (le style éperonnant) as oblong object w/ its tissues, webs, sails, veils, thus its apotropaic power > also an umbrella
SP.linkedContent: style-spur (le style éperonnant) as oblong object w/ its tissues, webs, sails, veils, thus its apotropaic power > also an umbrella

SP.content: what impresses mark of stylate spur in question of woman? this doesn’t concern la figure de la femme: question of figure open and closed by “woman” > concerns instead her abduction (s’enlever)
SP.linkedContent: what impresses mark of stylate spur in question of woman? this doesn’t concern la figure de la femme: question of figure open and closed by “woman” > concerns instead her abduction (s’enlever)

SP.content: Nietzsche’s writing as inscription of truth, elevated (se lève) in quotation marks (machination, cri, vol et pinces d’une grue), cet écart de la vérité qui s’enlève d’elle-même > the feminine “operation”
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s writing as inscription of truth, elevated (se lève) in quotation marks (machination, cri, vol et pinces d’une grue), cet écart de la vérité qui s’enlève d’elle-même > the feminine “operation”

SP.content: if style were a man (like Freud says penis is prototype of fetishes), writing would be a woman
SP.linkedContent: if style were a man (like Freud says penis is prototype of fetishes), writing would be a woman

SP.content: for Nietzsche, since man alone believes in woman-truth, women feminists are men too, lay claim to truth > perd le style (gone the style)
SP.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, since man alone believes in woman-truth, women feminists are men too, lay claim to truth > perd le style (gone the style)

SP.content: pratique stylet, pratique stylée, de quel genre? can’t be written w/out conjoined fabulation of woman/truth, entre la femme, in spite of the profundity that is modesty
SP.linkedContent: pratique stylet, pratique stylée, de quel genre? can’t be written w/out conjoined fabulation of woman/truth, entre la femme, in spite of the profundity that is modesty

SP.content: Nietzsche’s style not an impregnable, infinite mastery, doesn't impeccably manipulate the snare (piège), doesn’t calculate the undecidable like Leibniz’ God (a falling back into the trap), nor does he use parody/simulacrum as a weapon, which would lead to a Nietzsche cult (interprêtrise of parody) > rhythmic blindness of hymen/margin “inscribes castration’s effect w/in itself” > dans le toile du texte, Nietzsche is lost, a spider, or spiders, unequal to the web spun
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s style not an impregnable, infinite mastery, doesn't impeccably manipulate the snare (piège), doesn’t calculate the undecidable like Leibniz’ God (a falling back into the trap), nor does he use parody/simulacrum as a weapon, which would lead to a Nietzsche cult (interprêtrise of parody) > rhythmic blindness of hymen/margin “inscribes castration’s effect w/in itself” > dans le toile du texte, Nietzsche is lost, a spider, or spiders, unequal to the web spun

SP.content: question of style, spurring-operation, more powerful than thesis, meaning: stylate spur rips through veil, to show the veil, to undo opposition veil/unveiled (sailed/unsailed) [voilé/dévoilé]
SP.linkedContent: question of style, spurring-operation, more powerful than thesis, meaning: stylate spur rips through veil, to show the veil, to undo opposition veil/unveiled (sailed/unsailed) [voilé/dévoilé]

SP.content: never has been the style, the woman, the simulacrum, the sexual difference [un gai savoir]
SP.linkedContent: never has been the style, the woman, the simulacrum, the sexual difference [un gai savoir]

SP.content: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance
SP.linkedContent: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance

DST.content: thus Lacoue-Labarthe’s “style,” ethos, multiplying parentheses, rhythm of warnings, which don’t protect anyone > warning stands watch so no one will fail to expose oneself
DST.linkedContent: thus Lacoue-Labarthe’s “style,” ethos, multiplying parentheses, rhythm of warnings, which don’t protect anyone > warning stands watch so no one will fail to expose oneself

EJQB.content: fragment: neither determined style nor failure, it’s the form of that which is written
EJQB.linkedContent: fragment: neither determined style nor failure, it’s the form of that which is written

LI.content: “I” w/ quotation marks marks tendencies, styles, types, situations rather than a person
LI.linkedContent: “I” w/ quotation marks marks tendencies, styles, types, situations rather than a person

TN.content: “my impertinence will be my tact”: baroque composition, flaunted taste for delirious profusion > response to aporias of text
TN.linkedContent: “my impertinence will be my tact”: baroque composition, flaunted taste for delirious profusion > response to aporias of text

ATM.content: [Levinas’ negotiation w/ interruption and reappropriation] is a style, an idiom that marks the negotiation w/ a singular and irreplaceable seal
ATM.linkedContent: [Levinas’ negotiation w/ interruption and reappropriation] is a style, an idiom that marks the negotiation w/ a singular and irreplaceable seal
